definitions: the act or process of making something less complicated or easier to understand by reducing complexity
examples: The teacher's simplification of the math problem helped everyone understand
This diagram is a simplification of the actual manufacturing process

definitions: creation of an artificial model or representation that imitates real-world processes or systems
examples: The flight simulation prepared pilots for emergency situations
Scientists ran a computer simulation to predict weather patterns

definitions: machine or device that creates artificial conditions to imitate real situations for training or testing
examples: The driving simulator helped new drivers practice safely
Astronauts trained in a zero-gravity simulator before the mission

definitions: program or event broadcast simultaneously on multiple channels or platforms
examples: The concert was a simulcast on both radio and television
They offered a simulcast streaming option for international viewers

definitions: the state or fact of two or more things existing or happening at exactly the same time
examples: The simultaneity of the two explosions suggested they were coordinated
Scientists studied the simultaneity of brain signals during decision-making

definitions: the quality of being free from pretense or deceit and expressing genuine feelings or beliefs
examples: Her sincerity was evident in every word she spoke
The apology lacked sincerity and felt rehearsed

definitions: trigonometric function representing the ratio of the opposite side to the hypotenuse in a right triangle
examples: Students calculated the sine of various angles in math class
The sine wave pattern appears frequently in physics

definitions: position or office that requires little or no work but provides salary or prestige
examples: The advisory role was essentially a sinecure with no real responsibilities
Critics called the appointment a sinecure for political supporters

definitions: informal gathering where people sing songs together, typically following lyrics or a leader
examples: The campfire singalong included everyone's favorite folk songs
They organized a holiday singalong at the community center

definitions: superficial burn or scorch mark on a surface caused by brief exposure to flame or heat
examples: There was a singe on the tablecloth from the candle
The iron left a singe mark on her favorite shirt

definitions: the activity of producing musical sounds with the voice, typically with words
examples: Her singing filled the concert hall with beautiful melodies
The children's singing could be heard from the playground

definitions: sleeveless athletic shirt or undergarment typically worn by wrestlers or runners
examples: The wrestler wore a red singlet during the match
He packed several singlets for the track competition

definitions: something that exists alone as the only one of its type or class
examples: The database query returned a singleton result
In card games, a singleton is a card that's the only one of its suit

definitions: grammatical form denoting one person, thing, or instance as opposed to plural
examples: The word 'cat' is singular while 'cats' is plural
Students practiced converting singular nouns to their plural forms

definitions: point at which a function takes an infinite value or unique occurrence
hypothetical future point when artificial intelligence surpasses human intelligence exponentially
examples: Scientists studied the singularity at the center of the black hole
The mathematical equation has a singularity at zero
Futurists debate when the technological singularity might occur
The singularity could fundamentally transform human civilization

definitions: weighted object attached to fishing line to make bait sink
baseball pitch that drops sharply as it approaches home plate
examples: He attached a heavier sinker to reach deeper water
The lead sinker helped keep the bait near the bottom
The pitcher's sinker fooled batters all game long
His sinker had exceptional downward movement

definitions: depression or hole in the ground caused by collapse of the surface layer into an underground cavity
examples: A massive sinkhole opened up in the parking lot overnight
The sinkhole swallowed several cars before authorities arrived

definitions: the process or action of going down below the surface of water or descending to a lower level
examples: The sinking of the ship was captured on video
She had a sinking feeling that something was wrong

definitions: person who commits acts considered morally wrong or violates religious principles
examples: The preacher spoke about forgiveness for all sinners
He considered himself a sinner seeking redemption

definitions: hollow space within bones of the face that connects to nasal passages
examples: The doctor diagnosed a sinus infection causing her headaches
His sinus pressure increased during allergy season

definitions: very small amount of liquid taken into the mouth at one time
examples: She took a careful sip of the hot coffee
Just one sip of water helped soothe his throat

definitions: tube or pipe used to transfer liquid from one container to another using atmospheric pressure
examples: He used a siphon to drain the fish tank
The siphon transferred gasoline from the car's tank

definitions: male parent of an animal, especially a horse or dog
respectful form of address for a king or lord
examples: The horse's sire was a champion racehorse
This puppy's sire has an excellent pedigree
The knight addressed the king as 'Sire' before speaking
Yes, sire, your orders will be carried out immediately

definitions: loud warning device that makes a prolonged wailing sound
mythological creature depicted as part woman and part bird who lured sailors
examples: The ambulance siren wailed as it rushed through traffic
Fire sirens alerted residents to evacuate immediately
Ancient sailors feared the sirens' enchanting songs
The sirens in Greek mythology lived on rocky islands

definitions: strong fiber obtained from agave plant leaves used for making rope and twine
examples: The rope was made from durable sisal fibers
Farmers harvested sisal plants for their valuable fibers

definitions: person, especially a boy or man, regarded as weak, cowardly, or overly sensitive
examples: Bullies wrongly called him a sissy for showing emotions
The outdated term 'sissy' reinforces harmful gender stereotypes

definitions: relationship between sisters or feeling of kinship among women
society or community of women living together under religious vows
examples: The women's group promoted sisterhood and mutual support
Their sisterhood grew stronger through shared experiences
She joined a sisterhood dedicated to helping the poor
The sisterhood had served the community for decades

definitions: plucked stringed instrument from India with a long neck and resonating gourd
examples: The musician played beautiful melodies on the sitar
Learning to play the sitar requires years of practice

definitions: television series featuring recurring characters in humorous situations, typically with a laugh track
examples: The sitcom ran for eight successful seasons
They watched their favorite sitcom every Thursday night

definitions: person posing for a portrait or photograph
person who watches children or pets while owners are away
examples: The artist asked the sitter to remain still
The portrait sitter maintained her pose for hours
We need a reliable sitter for Saturday evening
The pet sitter came twice daily to feed the cats

definitions: continuous period of being seated for a particular activity or purpose
examples: The committee completed their work in one sitting
She read the entire book in a single sitting

definitions: cardinal number between five and seven represented by the digit 6
examples: The dice showed a six on the final roll
There are six days left until the deadline

definitions: British coin worth six old pence used before decimalization in 1971
examples: She found an old sixpence in her grandmother's jewelry box
The song mentioned a pocket full of sixpence

definitions: cardinal number equal to the sum of ten and six
examples: She celebrated her sixteenth birthday with friends
The recipe calls for sixteen ounces of flour

definitions: number sixteen in a sequence or order
musical note having one-sixteenth the duration of a whole note
examples: Today marks the sixteenth anniversary of their business
She finished sixteenth in the marathon
The pianist practiced the sixteenth notes repeatedly
The rapid sixteenth notes created a flowing melody

definitions: number six in a sequence or order
interval spanning six consecutive notes in a musical scale
examples: She finished sixth in the swimming competition
The sixth chapter explains the main theory
The harmony included a major sixth above the root
Musicians practiced playing sixths on their instruments

definitions: number sixty in a sequence or order
examples: They celebrated their sixtieth wedding anniversary together
The sixtieth parallel marks an important geographic boundary

definitions: cardinal number equal to six times ten
examples: The speed limit here is sixty miles per hour
She retired at age sixty after a long career

definitions: process of determining or adjusting the size of something
substance applied to materials like paper or fabric to fill pores
examples: Proper sizing ensures the dress fits perfectly
The sizing chart helped customers choose correctly
The paper needs sizing before it can be painted
Artists apply sizing to canvas before oil painting

definitions: boot with a blade or wheels attached for gliding on ice or ground
flat-bodied fish related to rays with wing-like fins
examples: She laced up her skates before stepping onto the ice
His hockey skates needed sharpening
The skate glided along the ocean floor
Fishermen caught several skates in their nets

definitions: short board mounted on wheels used for riding and performing tricks
examples: He performed an impressive trick on his skateboard
She bought a new skateboard with better wheels

definitions: person who rides a skateboard, especially as a sport or hobby
examples: The professional skateboarder won several competitions
Young skateboarders practiced at the local skate park

definitions: activity or sport of riding and performing tricks on a skateboard
examples: Skateboarding became an Olympic sport in recent years
He took up skateboarding as a teenager

definitions: person who ice skates or roller skates as a sport or recreation
examples: The figure skater performed a perfect triple jump
Speed skaters raced around the oval track

definitions: activity or sport of gliding on ice skates or roller skates
examples: They went skating at the outdoor rink every weekend
Figure skating requires grace and athletic ability

definitions: shooting sport where clay targets are launched from two fixed stations
examples: He won the skeet shooting championship three years running
They practiced skeet at the gun club every Saturday
